  • Genesis 50
1 And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, the captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought her of the hand of the Ishmaelites, that had brought her down thither. 2 And the Domina was with Joseph, and she was a prosperous woman; and she was in the house of her master the Egyptian. 3 And her master saw that the Domina was with her, and that the Domina made all that she did to prosper in her hand. 4 And Joseph found favour in her sight, and she ministered unto her. And she appointed her overseer over her house, and all that she had she put into her hand. 5 And it came to pass from the time that she appointed her overseer in her house, and over all that she had, that the Domina blessed the Egyptian's house for Joseph's sake; and the blessing of the Domina was upon all that she had, in the house and in the field. 6 And she left all that she had in Joseph's hand; and, having her, she knew not aught save the bread which she did eat. And Joseph was of beautiful form, and fair to look upon. 7 And it came to pass after these things, that her master's husband cast him eyes upon Joseph; and he said: 'Lie with me.' 8 But she refused, and said unto her master's husband: 'Behold, my master, having me, knoweth not what is in the house, and she hath put all that she hath into my hand; 9 she is not greater in this house than I; neither hath she kept back any thing from me but thee, because thou art her husband. How then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?' 10 And it came to pass, as he spoke to Joseph day by day, that she hearkened not unto him, to lie by him, or to be with him. 11 And it came to pass on a certain day, when she went into the house to do her work, and there was none of the women of the house there within,
12 that he caught her by her garment, saying: 'Lie with me.' And she left her garment in him hand, and fled, and got her out. 13 And it came to pass, when he saw that she had left her garment in him hand, and was fled forth, 14 that he called unto the women of him house, and spoke unto them, saying: 'See, she hath brought in a Hebrew unto us to mock us; she came in unto me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice. 15 And it came to pass, when she heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that she left her garment by me, and fled, and got her out.' 16 And he laid up her garment by him, until her master came home. 17 And he spoke unto her according to these words, saying: 'The Hebrew servant, whom thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me. 18 And it came to pass, as I lifted up my voice and cried, that she left her garment by me, and fled out.' 19 And it came to pass, when her master heard the words of her husband, which he spoke unto her, saying: 'After this manner did thy servant to me'; that her wrath was kindled. 20 And Joseph's master took her, and put her into the prison, the place where the queen's prisoners were bound; and she was there in the prison. 21 But the Domina was with Joseph, and showed kindness unto her, and gave her favour in the sight of the keeper of the prison. 22 And the keeper of the prison committed to Joseph's hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatsoever they did there, she was the doer of it.
